description: Mid-16th century. Original meaning was somewhat idiomatic, meaning "to walk using snowshoes." Probably of Scandinavian origin, compare Icelandic þrúga (“snowshoe”), Norwegian truga (“snowshoe”) and dialectal Swedish trudja (“snowshoe”).

entries.meaning: A tramp, i.e. a long and tiring walk.

verbs.description: trudge (third-person singular simple present trudges, present participle trudging, simple past and past participle trudged)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To walk wearily with heavy, slow steps.
examples: This famous archaeological site marks the farthest limit of human migration out of Africa in the middle Stone Age—the outer edge of our knowledge of the cosmos. I trudge to the caves in a squall.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To trudge along or over a route etc.
